PDM control silence pattern activation. This bit must be set to 1 before sending control pattern, then it stays high during pattern repetitions. It is automatically reset

Control pattern flow enabled through PDM2: 0 = Enabled 1 = Disabled
Value of MSB bits of control pattern. This register is effective only when 16-bit control patterns are selected. Otherwise LSB only are issued.

SAI1 alignment mode respect to FSYN relevant edge 0 = Serial data communication is left aligned 1 = Serial data communication is right aligned
SAI1 word length 0 = 8 bit 1 = 16 bit 10 = 20 bit 11 = 24 bit
SAI1 delayed mode setting 0 = Serial data is valid starting from the first bit of the communication 1 = Serial data is valid with one bitclk

SAI1 master/slave mode 0 = Slave 1 = Master

RegisterInfo.name: Sample Rate Converter (SRC) DPLL Lock Status

Bits.desc: Output SRC1 synchronous mode digital PLL lock 0 = SRC1out is unlocked 1 = SRC1out is locked
Output SRC2 synchronous mode digital PLL lock 0 = SRC2out is unlocked 1 = SRC2out is locked
Input SRC1 synchronous mode digital PLL lock 0 = SRC1in is unlocked 1 = SRC1in is locked
Input SRC2 synchronous mode digital PLL lock 0 = SRC2in is unlocked 1 = SRC2in is locked
SRC1 synchronous mode enable 0 = SRC is asynchronous mode 1 = SRC is synchronous mode (SAI1 clocks must be synchronous with system clock)
SRC2 synchronous mode enable 0 = SRC is asynchronous mode 1 = SRC is synchronous mode (SAI2 clocks must be synchronous with system clock)
Output SRC2 signal bandwidth 0 = up to 20kHz 1 = up to 8kHz 1X = up to 4kHz
Output SRC1 signal bandwidth 0 = up to 20kHz 1 = up to 8kHz 1X = up to 4kHz
SRC1out channel 1 input selector 0000 = DWS ch1
SRC1out channel 2 input selector 0001 = DWS ch2
SRC2out channel 1 input selector 0000 = DWS ch1 (default)
SRC2out channel 2 input selector 0001 = DWS ch2 (default)
Sidetone enabled on SRC2 input channel 2:0 0 = Disabled 1 = Enabled
Sidetone enabled on SRC2 input channel 1:0 0 = Disabled 1 = Enabled
Sidetone transmitting channel selector: 0 = SRC2 output 1 1 = SRC2 output 2
Sidetone receiving channel selector: 0 = SRC2 input 1 1 = SRC2 input 2

LSBs of sidetone coefficient on selected receiving channel (unsigned, from 0 to +2)

Selects the audio signal hysteretic double threshold to be used both for ZC based volume ramp control and for automute feature. This selection applies to volume control

Selects the automute operating mode. This selection applies to volume control units 1 and 2, that are corresponding to SDM 1 and SDM 2 channels 0 =
Selects the automute operating mode. This selection applies to volume control units 3 and 4, that are corresponding to PDM1 and PDM2 channels 0 = Automute OFF

Equalizer channel 3 input selector: 0 = MIX1 ch3 1 = MIX2 ch1
Equalizer channel 4 input selector: 0 = MIX1 ch4 1 = MIX2 ch2

This address is reserved to coefficient memory access in RW mode according to an enhanced protoco
When high it allows cache cleaning (reset to 0) upon cache2biquad transfer.

PLL fine lock signal (0.25% precision) 0 = PLL not locked 1 = PLL locked (less then 0.25% far from target 12.288MHz frequency) I2C_SCL

Enables LV charge pump clock inversion 0 = Normal 1 = Inverted

Headphone 1 amplifier enable 0 = Disabled 1 = Enabled

Reference group fast charge enable pulse duration. From 0 to 64 ms.

Spread Spectrum enable 0 = SSC is disabled 1 = SSC is enabled I2C_SCL
FLL enable 0 = FLL is disabled 1 = FLL is enabled I2C_SCL
FLL saturation pulses number selection 0 = max UP/DOWN duration is 31 clock cycles 1 = max UP/DOWN duration is 15 clock cycles I2C_SCL
Set the mean FLL frequency during spread spectrum control I2C_SCL
FLL Decimation rate selection 0 = Always ON 1 = Active 1 every 8 input clock cycles 10 = Active 1 every 16 input clock cycles 11
Set the amplitude of FLL frequency modulation during spread spectrum control I2C_SCL
High when FLL Digital Clock Output is ready
High when FLL Digital Clock is locked
MICPGA1 gain
MICPGA2 gain
AUXPGA2 gain
AUXPGA1 gain
Headphone 2 amplifier gain setting (only when HP2_IN_SEL -> 11, i.e. analog-to-analog mode)
Headphone 1 amplifier gain setting (only when HP1_IN_SEL -> 11, i.e. analog-to-analog mode)
Earphone amplifier gain setting
Input selector for earphone DAC 0 = MUTE 1 = SDM1 channel 10 = SDM2 channel 11 = MUTE
Enable for earphone output path 0 = Disabled 1 = Enabled
Volume selector on SDM 1 channel (target volume if volume ramp is selected)
Volume selector on SDM 2 channel (target volume if volume ramp is selected)
Volume selector on PDM 1 channel (target volume if volume ramp is selected)
Volume selector on PDM 2 channel (target volume if volume ramp is selected)

This field introduces a programalbe delay in 1ns increments on the PDM_SDA data line before it is sampled internally by the selected PDM_CLK edge
This field selects the sampling edge of the PDM_CLK used by the 88PM812 to sample the PDM_SDA stream
This field latches any over current event flagged by the class D amplifier, provided the CLASSD_EN field is set.
Analog gain.
Class D over current detector disable. 0 = over current detector disabled, 1 = over current detector enabled
Class D trianngle carrier wave frequency spread spectrum control. For test purposes only. 0 = feature enabled, 1 = feature disabled.
